intro: Commelina singularis, commonly known as the singular commelina, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers with white markings. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy surface, while the stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Commelina singularis is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
